metadata.title: CVE-2024-3861 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
If an AlignedBuffer were assigned to itself, the subsequent self-move couldresult in an incorrect reference count and later use-after-free. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 125, Firefox ESR < 115.10, and Thunderbird< 115.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-3861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.10.1+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs102: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
